column24: Other Statistics That We Should Look At :
Snubbed? Number of highest rated RT films vs nominees
How likely is a more oscarbait / less film to get nominated?

Limitations of the data : Only last x years. Would be more revealing to get a comprehensive overview
iMDB and Letterboxd can be contributed by anyone, not just critics or general uses
iMDB has a much larger sample size than other review platforms
The oscarbait algorithm is not perfect, by any means. Doesnt take into account a variety of factors
Not everyone reviews movies. People who leaave a review often have an existing bias. This is a miniscule sample of the poeple actualy watching a movie and, 
chances are if they're leaving a review they're 'into' movies more than the average joe.

Conclusions - Do the academy awards nominations accurately represent contemporary audiences? Uh. We don't really know
We DO know that, generally, the academy awards pretty well represent critics views of films. This IS a contemporary audience, and one that, arguably the academy awards is targetted towards.
What about a general audience? Yeah, again to an extent. Does it represent our growing tastes? Not 100%... but what does. Everyone is different. 
What about movie creators, directors and produces? Yes. Out of all the contemporary audiences, the best view this gives us is of them.

column1: Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)
Once Upon a Time... in Hollywood
All Quiet on the Western Front

Calculated : 
+/- 1 Point per 5 point difference between RT Critic and Audience scores
+/- 1 Point per 5 point difference between MC Critic and Audience scores
+/- 1 Point per 5 point difference between iMDB and Letterboxd scores
+ 2 points if the film is a drama
+ 2 points if the film is a period peice
+ 2 points if the film is a biopic
- 2 points if the film is not in English
+ 2 points if the film saw international release within 3 months of the ceremony
